intro: Trachypogon polymorphus subvar. dactyloides, commonly known as the narrowleaf muhly, is a grass species native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is characterized by its slender, grass-like blades and is typically found in arid or semi-arid environments. The plant has a clump-forming growth habit and produces small, pale blue or purple flowers during the summer months. It is often used in landscaping for its drought tolerance and ornamental value. Its botanical features make it well adapted to survive in harsh, dry conditions.
